title: Urgot's concept about fearing enemies after he ults seems.........weird
body: I understand about Darius's fear, being all high & mighty whilst going all "Thor mode" during his ult and shit. But Urgot? What about him? Like, he swaps places between his targeted enemy and his monstrous belly  & shouts "SURPRISE MOTHERF'CKER!!" at the enemies he appears to?

replies.body:
Your ally freezes in place, strange energy twisting around him. Then he suddenly vanishes. In his place stands a giant monstrosity, part war machine, part once dead but now reanimated man. Destructive energies cackle from him, the cannon on one arm in particular that he's readying in your direction. Blood drips from the blade on his other arm and that too's starting to spin up as he stares at you with dead, hateful eyes.

TLDR: Friend gone. Suddenly, monster machine/man/crab that's gonna cut you up big time. Therefore, feared.

Hm, whenever the Urgot remake comes around...maybe make more use of the bloodied blade?
Give him something of a short dash on one of his skills. Kinda like Udyr bear stance.
Short dash if close enough to target, jabs blade into their side, over time damage, minor slow that lasts a while/debuff refreshed by continuing to attack the target.
Would make him more scary and actually give him a reason to want to be close to the enemy.

Could you guys ever have a fully hybrid melee/range champ? Like Jayce but other than switching with his R, they just autoswitch based on distance from the enemy. Over 4 Teemos away from enemy, use a weaker ranged attack, get closer and they convert to stronger melee attacks.
Or would that be hell to balance and cause problems with things like {{item:3748}} {{item:3085}}?
Or just not something you would be interested in doing?

Also, I think the scarier part would be the guy who was paralyzed then suddenly they are teleported into 4 enemies...unless you're Amumu, then you're just like YAY FRIENDS *presses R
..but I understand why the original target does not get feared.
It's hard to take this seriously when you realize his model is abysmal.
